title: N-Lotka Volterra
description: Simulating N-Species Lotka-Volterra models to explain observed food-web structures.
summary: Analyzing simulation data from N-Species Lotka-Volterra models to bridge the gap between observed and predicted ecosystem populations.
Developed GPU kernals to run many simulations for data analysis to understand the role that structure plays in food-web stability over time.
Writing a research manuscript to publish the findings.

title: Voltskiya
description: Programmed Minecraft plugins to create a unique experience in a survival server.
summary: Created an extensive library of mob abilities for GameMasters.
Engineered a series of game features such as Temperature, Thirst, Stamina, and skill points.
Developed a MobSystem with customizable spawning contexts that pregenerates 50k mobs to fill the map.
comments: Working to develop for an ever-changing environment taught me the importance of writing code that leaves room for expansion.

title: Ambrosia Loans
description: Implemented a banking discord bot and database to manage loans and investments of Ambroisa Loans.
summary: Several tables have a history, so staff can use undo/redo commands to fix any mistakes they may make.
Staff manage loans and investments through 35+ discord commands.
Implemented a fully functional interest system that distributes profits to investors according to their investment stake.
